properties.areaDesc: Caroline; Westmoreland; Richmond; Northumberland; Western Essex
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Fort Walker to near Saint George Island.
Movement was northeast at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects.

Strong thunderstorms will be near...
Montross, Coles Point, Loretto, and Leedstown around 905 PM EDT.

Other locations impacted by these storms include Lerty, Currioman
Landing, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Rollins Fork, Oak Grove, Supply,
Singerly, Mount Holly, and Peeds.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN RICHMOND... NORTHEASTERN CAROLINE...WESTMORELAND AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Caroline; Westmoreland; Richmond; Northumberland; Western Essex
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Colonial Beach to Leedstown to 7 miles
southwest of Loretto. Movement was east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around
unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile
vehicles.

Strong thunderstorms will be near...
Montross, Champlain, Loretto, Newland, and Leedstown around 520 PM
EDT.
Hague and Coles Point around 535 PM EDT.

Other locations impacted by these storms include Lerty, Ethel,
Currioman Landing, Threeway, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Oak Grove,
Supply, Singerly, and Mount Holly.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHWESTERN RICHMOND...NORTHEASTERN CAROLINE...WESTMORELAND AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Caroline; Westmoreland; Eastern Louisa; Western Hanover; Western Essex
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Port Royal to 7 miles northwest of
Ladysmith to near Bumpass. Movement was east at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is
possible.

Strong thunderstorms will be near...
Port Royal and Fort Walker around 440 PM EDT.
Ladysmith around 445 PM EDT.

Other locations impacted by these storms include Chilesburg,
Golansville, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Guinea, Corbin, Supply, Penola,
Nancy Wrights Corner, and Cedar Fork.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LOUISA...CAROLINE... NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...NORTHWESTERN HANOVER AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT
